title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water, then drain.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
In a large skillet, cook diced pancetta or bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove from heat.
Add the drained pasta to the skillet and toss with the pancetta.
Pour the egg mixture over the pasta, tossing quickly to coat without scrambling the eggs. Add reserved pasta water a little at a time to achieve a creamy texture.
Serve immediately with extra Parmesan and freshly ground pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken pieces with yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, and spices (cumin, coriander, paprika, turmeric) for at least 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F) and bake or grill the marinated chicken until cooked through. Set aside.
In a large pan, heat oil or butter and sauté chopped onions until golden.
Add garlic, ginger, and spices (garam masala, cumin, coriander, paprika) and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree and cook for 5–7 minutes until thickened.
Stir in heavy cream or coconut milk, then add the cooked chicken. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

title: eba and ogbono
summary: a delicious nigerian delicacy made from dried cassava and dried ogbono tree seeds
ingredients: 500g assorted meat (beef, goat meat, or chicken)
Vegetable leaves (ugu or spinach), washed and chopped
instructions: Season and boil assorted meat with onions, seasoning cubes, and salt until tender. Set aside.
In a pot, heat palm oil and add the ground ogbono seeds. Stir continuously to avoid lumps.
Add meat stock gradually, stirring until the soup thickens.
Add crayfish, blended pepper, stockfish, and dried fish. Stir and allow to cook for 5–10 minutes.
Add the cooked meat and vegetable leaves. Simmer for 3 minutes and turn off heat.
For eba: boil water in a pot, reduce heat, and gradually add garri while stirring until smooth.
Serve the hot ogbono soup with eba.
